parameters.definition: Time effectiveness of cleansing chemical per unit
Time effectiveness of odor-removing chemical per unit
Minimum units of cleansing chemical required
Maximum total units of chemicals used per house
Maximum ratio of cleansing to odor-removing chemical

description: A cleaning company uses a cleansing chemical and odor-removing chemical to clean a house. Each unit of the cleansing chemical takes \param{Tc} units to be effective while each unit of the odor-removing chemical takes \param{To} minutes to be effective. The company must use at least \param{MinCleansing} units of the cleansing chemical. In total, at least \param{MaxTotal} units of chemicals can be used per house. Further, because the cleansing chemical is strong, there can be at most \param{MaxRatio} times the amount of cleansing chemical as odor-removing chemical. How many units of each should be used to minimize the total time it takes for a house to be cleaned?
